fields.description:
Would be nice to have Back to JIRA button in the Portfolio Plan view. 

Thanks,

Ewa
fields.summary: Back to JIRA button from Portfolio

fields.description:
Currently, JPO does not allow for estimation data outside of Story Points or Days/Hours.  Customers who have opted to use a custom field as their estimation statistic in JIRA Software are unable to use Portfolio without converting to Story Points or Time Tracking and re-estimating their issues.  

Please allow for the import of custom estimation statistics into Portfolio's estimation field.
fields.summary: Allow Portfolio to use custom fields set as Estimation Statistics on source boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When issue having multiple releases in JIRA then being imported into Portfolio, when filtering it via the _Release_ drop down from Portfolio, the schedule end will not show

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.5
* JIRA Portfolio 2.2.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and associate multiple version into it (more than 2 version at least, example= Release A and Release B)
# Import this issue to Portfolio
# Filter it via _Releases_ drop down, select Release A and subsequently select Release B

h3. Expected Results
Release A will show the schedule end
Release B will also show the schedule end

h3. Actual Results
Release A will show the schedule end
Release B will not show the schedule end
 
h3. Notes
This has something to do with the algorithm from Portfolio where it understands that case it seems that when filtering by version, the issue is only shown as scheduled when filtered by the first (in time or by rank if no time is specified) version.
fields.summary: filtering for certain release will not show schedule end in scope view

fields.description:
Issuekey in JQL causes unexpected behavior in Portfolio plan. The issuekey portion of the JQL must include at least one issue for each project that the entire query returns
 * Example behavior: Target Date does not appear on some issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Install JIRA Software + JIRA Portfolio
 # Create three sample JIRA Software Projects - Scrum project type
 ** The purpose of this is to create three identical projects with identical issues
 # Choose a Story and reopen that issue in each of the three projects. Add "test" label to each
 ** Used AAA-15 in testing
 # Create filter and save as new filter
 ** "issue in (AAA-15, BBB-15, CCC-15)" (replace AAA/BBB/CCC with your project keys)
 # Create new Portfolio plan based off of the saved filter. Select all stories
 # Three stories appear in plan. Set "Target Date" for each and commit changes
 ** Notice that the three stories now have a target date as they should

Next:
 # Change saved filter then refresh plan
 ** "issue in (AAA-15, BBB-15, CCC-15) or labels = test"
 ** Notice same results in issue navigator. Portfolio plan does not show any change, Target Date shows for all *three issues*
 # Change saved filter then refresh plan
 ** "issue in (AAA-15) or labels = test"
 ** Notice same results in issue navigator. Portfolio plan does change, Target Date only shows for *one issue*
 # Set target date on one of the issues where it is missing. Commit change
 ** Target Date disappears when change is committed

h3. Expected Behavior:

Multiple JQL queries returning the same set of results should perform the same even though filter JQL may be different.
h3. Workaround:

Use "issue in (x,x,x)" where (x,x,x) includes at least one issue from each project that has an issue in the results of the full JQL query
h3. Notes:

"issueKey" has the aliases: "id", "issue", "key"
fields.summary: Issuekey in JQL causes unexpected behavior in Portfolio plan
Violation dependency should be explained - display which issue could not be scheduled

fields.description:
I often find myself confused as to why the red exclamation mark about skill gaps (or dependency issues) occur. I know there is a confluence page on skills, and gaps, but it's still very unclear why a specific issue occurs.

In my specific case it was because JIRA already has an assignee to my story, and Portfolio couldn't change the assignee to someone that had the right skills... and the current assignee didn't have the skills - so i got an exclamation. Setting the assignee to 'unassigned' resolved the problem, but would've been nice to have a better explanation.
fields.summary: Explain the reasons why skill gaps occur

fields.description:
I see that I can add custom fields from JIRA to Portfolio.  However, I can only add Text & Numeric fields (but not Date Picker, Drop Down List, Checkboxes, ...).  I'm assuming Portfolio just doesn't have these controls available.



It would be great if we could use the Date Picker field for instance, that way I can set dates in Portfolio that carry over to my JIRA tasks as well as my Dashboards.  Right now, I have to update dates in both JIRA & Portfolio if I'm going to key of these dates on any of my dashboards & subscriptions.
fields.summary: Add JIRA fields in Portfolio

fields.description:
For Kanban team, the first available piece of work is assigned to the first list release even if it's far in the past. The next piece of work is then assigned to the next release matching today's date as expected.

Releases in Portfolio only `disappear` when archived, so this even happens on versions marked as `Released`.

 

To reproduce:
 * Create a kanban team
 * Create an issue with an estimate and no release assignment
 * Add a release started/released way back in the past (optionally mark it as released in JIRA)
 * Calculate

The issue will be assigned to the past release wrongly. Switching the team to scrum shows the correct behavior.
fields.summary: Scheduling wrongly plan work for the first release even if released or in the past

fields.description: Issue hierarchy can only be configured at global level in current version of Portfolio and this impacts all the plans being setup in that instance of Portfolio. While this may work for organizations having project of similar nature and scale, it's not very tenable for organizations with projects of differing nature (Hybrid Agile, Scrum, SAFe, etc) and scale (project, program, portfolio, enterprise). To support a varied setup, it will be helpful to configure issue hierarchy at the plan level (rather than at global level).
fields.summary: As a project manager I should be able to configure custom issue hierarchy at plan level in Portfolio

fields.description:
Can an enhancement to JIRA Portfolio be created to be able to filter out as will as filter in.

For example, if I want to filter for certain releases I just check them, which works great.  However, some times I want to not display certain releases but still see everything else including items that may not be assigned to a release or is beyond the horizon and I have no way to do this.

Thanks, 

*Cheryl Hatos*

Sr Director, Product Management
fields.summary: JIRA Portfolio Filter Out Feature

fields.description:
We have a setup with 2 additional hierarchy levels above Epic. Our total hierarchy is:
 # Sub-Task
 # User Story
 # Epic
 # Episode
 # Saga

Users regularly ask for a way to get all issues that contribute to one or several Saga's or Episodes. Currently there is no way to do this.
fields.summary: Filter all issues that contribute to a grand-parent issue

fields.description:
Portfolio does not schedule issue when its status category is `Done`.

Some use case exist where we do not want an issue considered done but it should not appear in the schedule. In that case it could be useful to have a plan configuration allowing to define custom status to consider as `Done` regardless of their status category.
fields.summary: Allow to configure which issue status should be considered done

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, this values are only available within the Portfolio Add-on

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to expose these fields back to their JIRA issues. 

h3. Why this is important
Users will be able to use these values for other functionalities within JIRA.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to expose the portfolio's scheduled date fields in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Project Keys Truncated in Schedule View in Live Plan

Steps to reproduce current behavior:
1. Navigate to plan page
2. Edit plan 
3. In schedule setting, select the LINE to be Projects. 

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to see the entire project key. Additionally we should be able to hover over the project key to get the full project name as well.

h3. Actual Results
The project keys are truncated as seen in the example screenshot below:

!jpo.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
While not a real workaround - Clicking on the plan filter will present the full project key and name as seen in the following screenshot:

!jpo2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add ability to show project name when mouse hovers on project key

fields.description:
I would like to have the ability to rank issue based on customfield value.
Could you also documentate the ranking engine.

How are ranked issues created in Portfolio directly ?
How are ranked issues from project no using Agile ?
fields.summary: Allow to rank issue based on customfield value

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Schedule range filter filters out issues in-range issues if their target dates fall outside the range

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Setup a plan with the following issues
||ISSUE||Scheduled start||Scheduled end||Target start||Target end||
|ISSUE-A|11/04/2017|19/05/2017|09/03/2017|19/05/2017|
|ISSUE-C|11/04/2017|19/05/2017|18/04/2017|20/04/2017|
# Set schedule range: 01/04/2017 - 30/04/2017

h4. Expected result
The capacity will include ISSUE-A and ISSUE C, as Portfolio's schedule range should include issues when EITHER the scheduled start/end OR the target start/end match the scheduling range filter 

h4. Actual Result
The capacity will change and filter out ISSUE-A as its target start/end falls outside schedule range
fields.summary: Schedule range filter filters out issues in-range issues if their target dates fall outside the range

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When clicking on the create issue button and opening that in a new tab or new window the JPO custom fields configured for that screen are not properly shown as their respective text box with drop down list is not shown; only the title of the field is shown.  However if instead of opening a new tab or window the pop up create issue is used the custom fields are correctly shown in the create issue screen.
This issue was reported for two custom fields "Team" and "Parent Link".

h2. Environment

* JIRA 7.2.6
* JPO 2.2.4


h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA 7.2.6
# Install JPO 2.2.4
# Configure the "Team" and "Parent Link" custom fields to be shown in the create issue screen
## Goto Custom Fields
## Find the "Team" custom fiel and click on Screens
## Tick the checkboxes for  "Scrum Bug Screen" and "Scrum Default Issue Screen"
## Click on the Update button
## Repeat the same steps for the "Parent Link" custom field
# Right click on the create issue button and open it in a new tab (or open it in a new window)
# Select the project, issue type and click on the next button


h2. Expected Results

The "Team" and "Parent Link" custom fields are shown with their respective text boxes and drop down lists (as it happens if just clicking on the create issue button)


h2. Actual Results

The text boxes and drop down lists for the "Team" and "Parent Link" custom fields are not shown.


h2. Workaround

The workaround is to use the Create Issue button instead of opening that in a new tab or window.


h2. Additional Information

* This problem cab be easily reproduced in a JIRA vanilla deployment.

* There are three different screen shots uploaded to this bug which are:

# JPO_CreateIssue : it shows when the fields are properly shown (when clicking on the Create Issue button)
# JPO_CreateIssue_onnewtab : it shows when the text box and drop down list are not shown (when opening a new tab)
# JPO_CreateIssue_onnewwin : it shows when the text box and drop down list are not shown (when opening a new window)

* The issue was reproduced using the following browsers:
Chrome 57.0.2987.133 (Official Build) (64-bit)
Firefox 52.0.2

* Using the Developer Tools on Chrome there is a difference between the one that properly shows the fields and those that they do not (please see the screenshots attached).  
The screens that do not properly show the fields have in the "Styles" tab the following 
"Inherited from div.aui-page-panel-inner".
fields.summary: Portfolio does not show the text box with drop down list for custom fields when opening create issue button in a new tab or window

fields.description:
When I Click the Create button and it opens a new page on JIRA (/secure/CreateIssue.jspa), the Parent Link field name is displayed, but there is no dropdown available.

!image-2017-04-07-18-18-06-272.png|width=450,height=147!

But, when the Create Issue opens as an Overlay on the existing View issue page, the "Parent Link" dropdown is visible and has values for selection.

!image-2017-04-07-18-19-53-316.png|width=466,height=209!

This needs to be fixed, so that we can start using Portfolio in our JIRA Production Environment
fields.summary: "Parent Link" is editable only on the Create Overlay and not Create Page

fields.description:
Create an overall timeline bar above the project roadmap lines at the top of the JIRA Portfolio page. The timeline could be 36 months in duration and would allow an immediate visualization of how all the project roadmap bars relate to each other over a 3 year period.

Apr-13 Jul-13 Sep-14 Dec-14 Jun-15
|                                            2013|                                      2014|                    2015|
|Jan-13|Feb-13|Mar-13|May-13|Jun-13|Aug-13|Sep-13|Oct-13|Nov-13|Dec-13|Jan-14|Feb-14|Mar-14|Apr-14|May-14|Jun-14|Jul-14|Aug-14|Oct-14|Nov-14|Jan-15|Feb-15|Mar-15|Apr-15|May-15|Jul-15|Aug-15|Sep-15|Oct-15|Nov-15|Dec-15|
|PROJECT 1| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |
| | | | | | |PROJECT 2| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |
| | |PROJECT 3| | | | | | | | | | | | | |
fields.summary: Overall Timeline for Portfolio

fields.description:
One of our largest customer (2,000 user tier) is working with sprints that are exactly 1 month duration. 4 Weeks duration in JIRA Portfolio is not good enough, since 4 weeks is not exactly as 1 month.

They would like to have an option to configure a team to have sprint duration of exactly 1 month (i.e., each sprint starts exactly at the 1st of each month).
fields.summary: Allow Month Sprint Length, instead of 4 weeks
Add Team Field for Emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1883].
  {panel}

Hi,

I have the following Hierarchy in portfolio.

Theme  -> Initiative -> Epic ->Story

The Theme issue type has a custom field by which I want to query the Initiatives, Epics and Stories within the Theme that has a particular value for the custom field. Is this currently possible?
fields.summary: JQL support for Multi level Parent Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1881].
  {panel}

We're trying to use the advanced filter (JQL) to search for all issues that are not assigned to a particular team using the Portfolio Team field. However, it’s not returning any results. After discussing with Atlassian support, it was stated that JIRA instance is not able to use advanced filters related to Portfolio fields.

 

This is the actual query I'm using: 

cf[11400] is not (27)

cf[11400] = Team Portfolio

(27) = Team A
fields.summary: Enable ability to use advanced filters to search for JIRA Portfolio fields
Add to the documentation the number of issues that a plan should be limited to.
support recurring tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1878].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in [Creating and configuring cross-project releases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/creating-and-configuring-cross-project-releases-828785313.html] it is not clear in the documentation how users can add existing releases to Cross project release 

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the documentation with: 
The CPR is basically a grouping over individual releases, thus you can create new release add it to an existing CPR. To do so:
# Create a new *Single release* for the project in the plan (or in the project)
# Click on the CPR name, which will show the details page
# Click *Add release* button, to add existing release.

Note that you can only have one release from a project in the CPR.
fields.summary: Improve documentation about cross project releases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1877].
  {panel}

With the "live plan", we can create different scenarios but it's not possible to "merge" them if the both of them has been updated.

It can be a good enhancement if JIRA Portfolio permits to :
 * Compare two scenarios, 
 * Automatically merge them
 ** and provides the conflict management 

Best regards,

 

Elodie
fields.summary: Permits a scenario merge
Additional fields for filtering in Scope view (even custom ones)
Error messages on the issue view sit above modal dialogs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1874].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When attempting to commit changes to a Portfolio Plan the user is presented with a infinate loading screen when commiting changes to a plan that they have added, if the user does not have permissions to create an issue for any item in the commit list
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Portfolio
 ** Tested on:
 *** 2.2.2
 *** 2.0.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove a users ability to create issues permission for a project on the plan
 # Login as user
 # have user add issue to plan
 # Commit Changes

h3. Expected Results
User is presented with a permission error noting they do not have permission to create the issue in the project

h3. Actual Results
User is presented with the page load Spinner and must press escape to exit with no indication of error onscreen:
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-22 at 11.28.41 AM.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{code:java}
2017-03-22 11:26:50,574 http-nio-63402-exec-17 WARN test 686x899x1 1f7gahs 172.20.44.21 /rest/jpo/1.0/issues/commit [c.a.j.env.issues.JiraIssueService] Could not create issue. Validation-errors: {pid=You do not have permission to create issues in this project.}
2017-03-22 11:26:50,574 http-nio-63402-exec-17 WARN test 686x899x1 1f7gahs 172.20.44.21 /rest/jpo/1.0/issues/commit [c.a.j.scenario.common.BaseScenarioEntityCommitService] Error in commit operation.
2017-03-22 11:26:50,574 http-nio-63402-exec-17 WARN test 686x899x1 1f7gahs 172.20.44.21 /rest/jpo/1.0/issues/commit [c.a.j.scenario.issue.IssueScenarioEntityCommitExceptionHandler] Exception when trying to commit issue: Specific error details: {pid=You do not have permission to create issues in this project.}.
{code}
The below Exception is displayed in the Javascript Console:
{code:java}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 ()
batch.js:44398 ajax[41210662] error : {
successful  : false,
status      : 400,
statusText  : error,
hasData     : true,
readyState  : 4,
requestId   : 41210662,
aborted     : undefined,
}
{code}
!Screen Shot 2017-03-22 at 11.45.49 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Changes can be committed by a user with create issue permission or grant create issue permission to the user
fields.summary: 400 Error on Commit Changes when user does not have create permission
Import non-working days from Agile board that is used as a source for JPO

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1872].
  {panel}

At the moment you have Scope, Teams, Releases perspectives in Portfolio.

However, there is no Resoruce (People) perspective. 

In Consulting business it is important to always know if a resource (consultant) is fully booked, or is there available capacity.

It is not possible currently to see capacity of a single person, if he is assigned to several teams. You need to manually look this person up in each team.
fields.summary: Resource Perspective

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1871].
  {panel}

At the moment it is not possible to have a dynamic team, when new people join or leave the team at some point in time.

In Consulting business we need plan our resources for the future, and it is not always possible to have a full team working unchanged until project end. 

Thus we would like to have a possibility to have a Start Date of a person in a team. And maybe End Date too. This could then be part of the calculation for capacity.

P.S. Also team member vacations should be taken into account.
fields.summary: Start/End Date for Team Members
Mechanism for Bulk Updates in Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1869].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
!subtask_view_missing.png|thumbnail!
As you can see the above screenshot there is no subtask view option available in the drop down menu
h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the option in order to switch to subtask view
fields.summary: subtask view option to be available in the drop down menu
Allow portfolio to book stories into sprints if any capacity is available
Gantt chart - Allow display of worked effort overlaying the estimated duration of a story/epic.
Adding an Issue to a Sprint that's in progress should warn the Portfolio user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1864].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, selecting the scope filter by completion date the completed issues are shown, but also the open issues.
*  !Completed since.png|thumbnail!

The customer would want to see *only* the completed issues in the selected period

h3. Suggested Solution
Show only completed issues 
 
h3. Workaround 
-
fields.summary: Scope filter Completed should only show completed issues
Allow sharing Themes between plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1862].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When you have this hierarchy configuration, Initiative > Epic > Story > Sub-Task

h3. Environment
* JIRA Portfolio 2.2.2
* JIRA 7.3.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup this hierarchy configuration, Initiative > Epic > Story > Sub-Task
# Create a live plan
# Create 2 shared team (Team A and Team B), 1 initiative and 2 Epic (Epic 1 and Epic 2) under this Initiative
# Assign Epic 1 to Team A and Epic 2 to Team B
# Now the Initiative should be assigned to both Team A and Team B
# Click on Uncommitted change
# Access the Initiative in JIRA side

h3. Expected Results
The team field should show both Team A and Team B

h3. Actual Results
The team field show only 1 Team which is either Team A or Team B
fields.summary: initiative should contained 2 team when applying uncommitted change to JIRA side

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1861].
  {panel}

I've got a portfolio board which has been tuned, by slicing and dicing against releases, and adjusting the relative order of the Initiatives and Epics.

The schedule now shows that story A is before story B - but in my Kanban board that isn't the case.

Is there a way of rewriting the relative ranks of everything in the portfolio plan, so that the ranking of stories now matches what the plan has scheduled?

Without that our team can't work on stories in priority order from their Kanban boards. :(.

Amy I missing something?
fields.summary: Burning a portfolio plan back into the rank so that Kanban boards are synced.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1860].
  {panel}

It seems I can change the rank of an Epic from within the Scope of a Portfolio plan - this is don't by selecting 'epic' and dragging an epic up or down relative to the other epics. This changes the relative rank of the epics.

 

What doesn't appear to happen though, is any change to the rank of the child stories. I would expect that if I dragged a epic above another one, then it's enclosing stories should now rank higher than the stories of the epic that is now ranked lower.

Is that supposed to work, or are there any tool sets I can use to make that happen?

It seems difficult to sync the schedule suggested by Portfolio back onto a board, so that the priorities set in the schedule affect the order of work that is picked up from the board (in a Kanban style).

 

Am I missing something?
fields.summary: Changes to Rank of an Epic don't change the Rank of their child Stories.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1859].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Users are not able to sort by the columns "Labels", "Themes" and "Releases on the Portfolio Scope view.

!Screen Shot 2017-03-07 at 1.55.24 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution

Make these columns sortable as the others.
fields.summary: Make the columns "Labels", "Themes" and "Releases sortable on Scope view.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1858].
  {panel}

Now, it is only possible to filter in Portfolio on open and closed issues. I'd like to see that I can filter on any status/statuscategory a ticket is in.

The reason for this is that we have a status called "To Write", "To Refine" and "Ready for Build". The PO works in Portfolio and wants to be able to have a quick overview of everything that still needs to be written or refined.

So, the user story is:

As a product owner I want to be able to filter on issue status and status category so that I can have a quick overview of all stories in a specific status

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * Filter is added in schedule navigation of Portfolio
 * Filtering is possible on individual status
 * Filtering is possible on status category
 * Schedule overview is updated according to filter
fields.summary: Add filter for issue status
Ability to set default estimate for Bugs/Defects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1856].
  {panel}

h3. Description of Problem
The "Creating and deleting a plan" documentation provides the following steps for creating a plan: 
# In your JIRA application go to Portfolio and click Create plan.
# Select the Live Plans template.

There is no longer any option to "Select the Live Plans template".

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Creating+and+deleting+a+plan
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/creating-and-deleting-a-plan-828785200.html

h3. Suggested Change:
Update steps to the following:
# In your JIRA application go to Portfolio and click Create plan.
# Enter a name for your plan and click Next.
fields.summary: Create Plan documentation needs update to remove live plan template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1855].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no version report which will project the release date and also the progress towards the date. This would be helpful as it will provide a better projection of the release date and also they are able make necessary adjustment for the next project. Besides, it should  take in consider the resources availability into account in the calculation. Example, holiday leave, vacation leave and also other etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a version report which provide all these vital information and calculation.
fields.summary: version report to project release date and progress
Cannot get to add-ons for Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1853].
  {panel}

This should be a bug ticket, As per below document I should have ability to configure the JIRA standard fields under epic but here its not possible. for example, I can't set the hierarchy "TASK" above the epic and its not an JIRA methodology.

 

This is strange from document and real implementation problem. Please make this as BLOCKER issue and fix it.

 

Documenation:

The default hierarchy contains:
 * *Epics* - Once the higher level priorities are settled it's necessary to break them down into large pieces of work, which consist of multiple stories.
 * *Stories* - User stories capture functionality requirements.
 * *Sub-task* - Work components that make up stories.
fields.summary: Unable to set other standard issues below epic
JIRA Portfolio to consider epic status when calculating schedule

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1850].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

It's not possible to create hierarchies below an Epic in Portfolio for JIRA.

*Suggested Solution*

Make it possible to create hierarchies below an Epic.
fields.summary: Hierarchies below an Epic in Portfolio for JIRA
Start date in JIRA portfolio plans
using "Due Date" of ticket as "Target end" on Portofolio Plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1847].
  {panel}

*As a* Product Owner

*I want to* assign stories to a Scrum Team from either Portfolio or JIRA and see it represented in both Portfolio and JIRA

*So that* I can see the same changes in both tools, depending on who I am talking to and in what context.
----
The following is currently possible with the Portfolio Team field:
 * you can create Shared teams in Portfolio and assign an issue to a team
 * It is also possible to Edit an issue in JIRA and change the Team field to one of the shared team.
 * It appears in the People section of the Browse Issue view.
 * You can add the Team field in the Card Layout on a specific board

Therefore the functionality is almost there but the following is not possible:
 * Add the Team field in the Issue Detail View (right pane when you click on an issue in the board)
 * Chose the Team field in gadgets in the Dashboards
 * Filter board content by Team when using the Agile Board Filter plugin
 * Create filters using the Team full names (it substitutes values with IDs) although that's a minor inconvenience.

My main issues are the Issue Detail View and the Dashboard.
fields.summary: Portfolio Team field should be a fully supported JIRA field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1846].
  {panel}

h1. Story

As a Product Manager, I want to be able to filter by Initiative or Epic, in order to help frame discussion and presentation when diving into Epic and Story view.
h1. Expansion

As my team get's deeper into Portfolio, we have multiple Product Mangers interacting with the same Plan. While we can drive high-level engagement using the Portfolio plan, it becomes a less useful when I want to focus on a specific Initiative, it's components or deliverables, as I can't provide a specific view.

This is especially obvious when I have more than one project which contributes to the same Initiative, and I'm engaging in focused project reviews with stakeholders.
fields.summary: Filter by Initiative & Epic
Display number of people instead of member icons in Members Column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1844].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition


The epic view groups all the issue without epic at the bottom regardless of their rank, so from there you have no way of actually ranking them below
in this case, some of his story without epics are ranked above other with epics and gets scheduled before
in the story view the ranking should match the scheduling result
now there is definitely no way to massively re-rank issues at the bottom from either view.

h2. Suggested Solution 

 It would be a sensible improvement suggestion to be able to (with some care) let a user rank all issues without epic at the bottom from the epic view.

h2. Workaround

From the agile board (as it lets you group select and drag-drop) to re-rank those issues without epic actually below those with an epic

Having a JQL with all the stories without epic (and only those) should be an easy one
then can attribute them to a 'later' or 'triage' or just temporary epic
then in the portfolio epic view if you drag&drop that epic at the bottom it will re-rank all stories below the other
other solution would be to add those stories to a release and set it in the far future / after everything else
fields.summary: Ability to schedule stories without epics, always after stories with epics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1843].
  {panel}

The documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-teams-members-availability-814212629.html] outlines functionality that we do not see present in our JIRA Portfolio 2.2 for server instance. Specifically:
 # There is no way to access member scheduling from the "Teams" panel - it must be done by going to Portfolio\Manage Shared Teams.
 # There is no way to set per-team availability in either the "Teams" panel or the "Manage Shared Teams" screen
 # There is no way to set "exceptions", only "absences" (the difference appears to be that an exception allows for partial impacts).

I have checked JAC to confirm that there isn't a filed bug for these features, and I have checked our Portfolio permissions to make sure I have 'shared team management' access.
fields.summary: Fix "Configuring teams members' availability" Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1842].
  {panel}

A common use-case for us is for a plan to be built around the sequential scheduling of Epics, rather than the order of Stories on a backlog.
There should therefore be an option in the configuration settings to choose between

A) Schedule based on Story Rank

B) Schedule based on Epic Rank

For example, Epic A might relate to the Initial Investigation phase of a project, Epic B to the Detailed Investigation, and so on.
While you can use an Agile board to order the underlying Stories into the correct sequence, it would be much easier if there were an option in Portfolio to simply schedule everything under Epic A first, then everything under Epic B second etc.

This would also cover the current problem that newly-created Stories always go to the bottom of the backlog and therefore are scheduled last by default, regardless of what Epic they belong to. For example, in the scenario above, if during the Initial Investigation stage a new work package/story is identified and created under Epic A, you would want Portfolio to automatically schedule that alongside the other Stories under Epic A.
fields.summary: Option to schedule by Epic rank rather than Story

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1841].
  {panel}

At the moment there are only two permission levels for Portfolio plans: editor and viewer.

A common use-case for us is that users want to be able to view the latest version of the plan based on changes they've made in the backlog/s, but are unable to see or hit the (re-)calculate button because they only have view rights.

They don't want to change anything in the plan, so don't have edit rights, they just want to see the latest version. Therefore it would be very useful to have a third permission option which is exactly the same as the View permission level but with the ability to hit 'calculate'.

An alternative solution for us would be to implement JPO-1523 (automatic recalculate option).
fields.summary: Plan level permission to view and (re-)calculate only
Identify Out-of-Plan Dependencies

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you have Team field in the create issue screen, the Team field will not rendered properly when you open the Create issue button in a new browser tab.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.3.1
 * JIRA Portfolio 2.2.2
 * Google Chrome (latest version)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Assign Team field to the issue create screen in one of the project
 # Access the create issue button in a new browser tab (right click the create button > open link in new tab)

h3. Expected Results

The Team field will be rendered correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The Team field is not rendered correctly:

!team_field_incorrect.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Access the create issue button in a standard popup dialog.
fields.summary: Team field in create issue field not render properly when open new browser tab
Add Epic Report in Jira Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1837].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
When estimating issue in Portfolio (entering the original estimate), the value of remaining estimate does not get entered automatically. Hence, when user logs the work, remaining estimate remains at 0. 

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Enter a value into Original Estimate in Portfolio live plan (lets say 10h)
# Refresh the plan (Original estimate = 10h, Estimate = _null_)
# Open the issue view page
# Log work (lets say 2 hours time spent)
# Refresh portfolio plan

h4. Expected result:
Issue view page should show
Original Estimate = 10h
Remaining Estimate = 8h
Log work = 2h

Portfolio plan should show
Original Estimate = 10h
Estimate (referring to remaining estimate) = 8h

h4. Actual Result
Issue view page should show
Original Estimate = 10h
Remaining Estimate = 0h
Log work = 2h
!time.png|thumbnail!

Portfolio plan should show
Original Estimate = 10h
Estimate (referring to remaining estimate) = 0
!plan.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Remaining estimate value does not get automatically filled in when user estimates issue in Portfolio (Original estimate)
Allow to show both time and story point original estimates columns
Add ability to report on hours logged on all child issues of an initiative outside of Portfolio itself
Wrong Sorting Tasks on timeline according priority

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is an "Original Story Point" estimate field which allows customers to 
The scheduling algorithm, however, ignores this column. 

The customer would want to have a field named for example "Target Story Points" and be able to check the plan for it

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.summary: Add "Target Story Points" field and possibility to calculate the plan based on its value
Provide a global capacity overview for team members

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1831].
  {panel}

JIRA Software provides the ability to have more than one in-progress sprint on a board.

Portfolio for JIRA cannot cope with this at the moment (see [https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwj-5vzu95HSAhWbOsAKHXjkAt0QFggcMAA&url=https%3A%2F%2Fanswers.atlassian.com%2Fquestions%2F39244236%2Fportfolio-handling-of-concurrent-ongoing-sprints&usg=AFQjCNFTncR-C44Oj_iI50pZ5yrMZqnXxg&sig2=_8ka0auE8-9RZUarWSr3Yg)]

 

If a Portfolio for JIRA plan links to a board with more than one in-progress sprint, it will select the first one and the issues in it, and completely ignore the other/s.

This is particularly a problem for dependencies and dependency scheduling, because if an issue further down the backlog _depends_ on an issue in that second in-progress sprint, it will also be 'ignored' and not scheduled because the thing it depends on is not being scheduled.
fields.summary: Support for concurrent sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1830].
  {panel}

In the configuration settings there is the option to turn 'Dependency Scheduling' off.
The description says that by doing so means "dependencies are highlighted but don't impact the schedule".

This is not the case, however, as the plan will still not schedule items based on their dependencies i.e. if there's a cyclic dependency, or if a dependent ticket cannot be scheduled for whatever reason.
By setting the 'Dependency Scheduling' option to 'Off' you should still get warnings about the dependencies a ticket may have, but it should not impact the schedule.
fields.summary: With dependency scheduling OFF warnings/errors should not impact scheduling
Remove released versions from Live Plans creation view
Team member availability to automatically reflect public holidays based on their/system locale
Theme Filter of "None" Would be Useful

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1826].
{panel}
When attempting to load a plan, users are presented with a 500 error page:

  !500.png|thumbnail!

Expanding this for more details show a long trace:
{code:java}
Technical details

Log's referral number: 6ab881f9-52a8-4dcd-ad79-56c30dff463b
Cause

Referer URL: Unknown

com.atlassian.jpo.env.jql.IssueSourceTranslationException: Invalid JQL or unable to translate.

com.atlassian.jpo.env.jql.IssueSourceTranslationException: Invalid JQL or unable to translate.
at com.atlassian.jpo.env.jql.JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.translate(JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.java:85)
at com.atlassian.jpo.env.projects.JiraProjectAnalysisService.getProjectIdsForIssueSources(JiraProjectAnalysisService.java:52)
at com.atlassian.jpo.issuesource.context.DefaultIssueSourceContextService.getProjectIdsForIssueSourcesWithoutFallback(DefaultIssueSourceContextService.java:95)
at com.atlassian.jpo.issuesource.context.DefaultIssueSourceContextService.extractProjectIdsFromIssueSourcesWithoutLimit(DefaultIssueSourceContextService.java:140)
at com.atlassian.jpo.issuesource.context.DefaultIssueSourceContextService.extractProjectIdsFromIssueSources(DefaultIssueSourceContextService.java:122)
at com.atlassian.jpo.issuesource.context.DefaultIssueSourceContextService.getProjectIdsForPlan(DefaultIssueSourceContextService.java:75)
at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.plugin.views.plan.common.CachedPlanInformationComponent.load(CachedPlanInformationComponent.java:68)
at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.plugin.views.plan.view.standard.PlanView.execute(PlanView.java:118)
at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:225)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:154)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:152)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:727)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.rm.common.env.EnvironmentServiceException: Unknown filter: 24562
at com.atlassian.jpo.env.jql.JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.translateFilter(JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.java:116)
at com.atlassian.jpo.env.jql.JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.translate(JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.java:75)
... 204 more{code}
 
h4. Cause
 * The plan is using an Agile board, which is then using a JQL filter that no longer exists or cannot be parsed.

h4. Expectation

The plan is loaded, indicating that the data has changed or is no longer available. It would show the configuration details of which Agile board is referenced or filter ID is being used.
h4. Actual

 The 500 page is presented and the user will have no course of action to understand how to fix the issue or what caused it.
h4. Workaround
 * Fix the filter being referenced by the Plan and ensure it is valid
 ** If plugin functionality is referenced, ensure that the plugin is installed and enabled or remove the plugin functions in the JQL
 * If the filter is no longer available, create a new filter and update the database, setting the new filter's ID to be the same as the originally referenced ID. A restart of JIRA is required after the change

h4. Additional Details 
 This error only occurs when the broken filter is associated with a JIRA Software board and that board is referenced by the plan. It does not occur when the plan directly references the broken filter.
* Different error appears when the plan directly references filter with invalid JQL (JqlParseException)
* When the filter is completely missing the plan will continue to load but without the board as an issue source.
fields.summary: Plan fails to load due to Invalid JQL or unable to translate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1825].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when the issues fall out of the plan, JIRA Portfolio will not schedule and calculate the original dependency.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can support on external dependency in both outside/inside of the plan, since there are some business requirement which will required to move the issues outside of the plan.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1824].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Theme report in Jira Portfolio Plan, the *Actual* work completed is based on the work log. The customer would like to see this based on issues completed (without logging work to it)

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a report which would consider work as completed when it is Resolved
 
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Add Report similar to the Theme Report, but where Actual work is based on completed issues
Make Portfolio Teams visible in JIRA Dashboard Gadgets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1822].
  {panel}

Hi there,

we are struggling a bit with Portfolio with managing external dependencies. Let me give you an example.

We have an Epic (e.g. New website), this includes a lot of tasks that are completely under our control (prepare texts, code HTML template) but also contains some tasks that are managed outside our team (e.g. check legal with lawyers, get design from external freelancer). 

The problem here is that we know how long this typically takes (e.g. lawyer check = 2-3 weeks, UX design 2-3 weeks), but we are struggling with modeling this in a Portfolio plan.

Here are some hacks we tried and got almost there.
 # Created an External team with Lawyer & Designer virtual team members.
 # Added 3 skills (Core, Legal, Design) with 100%, 0%, 0% default setup.
 # Setup our internal team for Core skill and External team (Laywer = Legal, Designer = Design)

This works pretty well.
 # Portfolio will not try to recalculate plan and assign tasks to External team if you dont explicitly estimate some work for Legal/Design skill.
 # You can make an upper limit capacity for your external suppliers (handy since you don't want to overload them when you need them on multiple projects simultaneously.

However. There is one minor glitch. If you actually don't care about capacity of the third party or you don't want to create a team member for every external supplier you are stuck.

*Suggestion:*

How about adding a special wait time estimate to tasks? You just say - this task will take about 20hours from an external source (skill) and i dont care about capacity planning. Everything else will just work as is.

Is there any other better way to model this in Portfolio?
fields.summary: Better support for managing external dependencies

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1821].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description 

Whenever there is a warning on issue, all of them have the same icon and hovering on it won't display the error message. Clicking the issue individually will take another effort. It would be great to have a feature to have multiple warning icon for different warning message and display the error message when users hover on the issue.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide multiple different icon for different warning message.
fields.summary: Provide multiple different icon for different warning message.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1820].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition
JIRA has setup with components. Each component represent components in the enterprise systems.  When issue (story/task) is created first in JIRA first, during the initial analysis phase the component is assigned to the issue in JIRA.
Later during the planning phase, where PMO is creating a plan through Portfolio issues are imported on the portfolio plan. In the portfolio teams and skill sets are defined so that portfolio can suggest resource allocation. The component field is also visible on portfolio now. But currently there is no direct association between component and either team or skill sets. So when portfolio suggests resource allocation (or when PMO 'calculates' for the schedule) the resources picked up are from random teams - without any consideration on the skill set/teams. So the development tasks/stories will get QA or BA resource getting assigned.  The only option is to go individually on all the issues and change the resource allocation manually.  When there are 100 - 200 different epics (with average 5-10 tasks/stories under each epic)  under development for different releases, it becomes extremely tedious job. 


h2. Suggested Solution
I think we can have feature/option to link JIRA component with Portfolio skill set or project teams. 
One can associate/link component with teams created in portfolio. 
For example:
Component "Pricing engine" can be mapped to "Pricing team". Similarly component "XYZ adapter" can be mapped to "XYZ adapter team". 

For someone skills are more helpful to plan. In that case one can associate component with skills and this can be many to many relationship. 
For example:
Component "Pricing engine" can have multiple skill set associated with it.  Other component "XYZ adapter" may have other skill sets, but can share some skill set from "Pricing engine" component.

One can create this association while creating a plan from JIRA issues or from the "Configure" plan option.

Once the link between component and teams/skills is established, portfolio can use it while suggesting resource allocation on a schedule or calculating capacity.  Portfolio can now suggests resources which are at least meaningful (based on the teams/skill set).



Again, this link can be kept optional. so only those who require to use can use. Those who do not need it can continue with current behavior.
fields.summary: Link Project Components with Portfolio Skills.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1819].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When showing a custom field using the Date Picker in Portfolio > Scope, the date is incorrect. 

Ex: Field in JIRA Issue View shows 07/Feb/17, however in Portfolio the field shows as 06/Feb/17

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field using the Date Picker
# Associate with screens in your given project
# Create an issue and populate the custom field with a date value
# Import Project issues in Portfolio
# Go to Configure > Custom Fields
# Add the newly added custom field
# View the field in Portfolio > Scope

h3. Expected Results
The same date as shown in JIRA issue

h3. Actual Results
The value shown is off by one day

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Custom Field using Date Picker Shows Incorrect Date in Portfolio
Surface target start and target end fields on JIRA ticket

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The top toolbar is hidden behind the administrative functions banner.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3 + Portfolio 2.2.0, 2.1.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the COG Icon > System and enter the admin credentials to access JIRA using the administrative functions;
# Browse a plan in Portfolio

h3. Expected Results
* The topbar to be displayed properly as per image below:
 !Screen Shot 2017-02-03 at 19.21.21.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

 !Screen Shot 2017-02-03 at 19.21.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Solution / Workaround

fields.summary: The top toolbar is hidden behind the administrative functions banner when viewing a plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1816].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Portfolio's live plan will show active sprint from the board that is listed as issue sources. Even if the issues associated to this active sprint are not being filtered in the plan (under scope).

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to exclude the active sprint in the board whose issues are not in portfolio live plan.
fields.summary: Having the option to exclude active sprint whose issues are not listed under scope
Relate the target / scheduled dates in Portfolio and the due date in JIRA.
Publish Portfolio for JIRA Java API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1813].
  {panel}

h2. Problem
In a plan that uses default estimates, an issue receives an "Item ignored - The estimates on this item are too small." violation which prevents the issue from being scheduled. However, entering a value of 0 will keep the issue from being scheduled anyway, so the only notable effect of this is the violation showing up on the issue in the scope table. The violation should not be there, but does not make a difference from a scheduling point-of-view.

h2. Work-around
Remove the explicit estimate of 0 on the issue (which will cause the issue to be unestimated, unless it receives an estimate via estimate conversion set up for its issue source. In that case, the secondary estimate should be removed from the issue, if possible).
fields.summary: Issues that are set to an estimate of 0 show "Item ignored" warning when default estimates are used
The field "Team" from JIRA Portfolio should keep the team name instead of the team id when saved as a filter.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1811].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Set assignees of subtasks might not be correctly imported from JIRA for the Portfolio schedule under the following conditions:
* there is an estimated subtask with an assignee set in JIRA and
* its parent story has no team restriction set in Portfolio and
* the Portfolio data source associated with the parent story is associated with at least two different teams in the plan.
This setup will cause Portfolio to detect an assignment conflict and use the parent's story assignment for the subtask overriding it's assignee.

h3. Workaround
Either set the correct team on the parent story or make sure (if possible) that this team is the only one associated with the data source of the issue.
fields.summary: JIRA assignees on subtasks are ignored in the Portfolio schedule

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1810].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The user wants the option to create a template for plans in Portfolio.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please, provide an option to create a plan template.
h3. Why this is important

This would be very useful since users could save some time since it wouldn't be necessary create a new plan from scratch every time.
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Templates for plans in Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1809].
  {panel}

h2. Problem
When the schedule is configured to show sprints and one of the lanes is empty (either does not show any issues or only shows a caption), selecting an issue in the scope table might lead to a bummer message popping up.

{code:java}
Cannot read property 'children' of undefined

TypeError: Cannot read property 'children' of undefined
at c.getModelFromIssueId (https://jira.intelie.com/s/beeb1903970417fbb56db7a437074874-CDN/-n4qo83/73011/61ff054b82e8d98ad612d82b470d3391/2.2.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:39:6076)

at t.l.matchModelAndSourcesForSelectedIssue (https://jira.intelie.com/s/beeb1903970417fbb56db7a437074874-CDN/-n4qo83/73011/61ff054b82e8d98ad612d82b470d3391/2.2.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:35:15879)
at t.l.adaptToExternalIssueSelection (https://jira.intelie.com/s/beeb1903970417fbb56db7a437074874-CDN/-n4qo83/73011/61ff054b82e8d98ad612d82b470d3391/2.2.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:35:13265)
at a.adaptToExternalIssueSelection (https://jira.intelie.com/s/beeb1903970417fbb56db7a437074874-CDN/-n4qo83/73011/61ff054b82e8d98ad612d82b470d3391/2.2.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:41:11197)
at a.adaptToExternalIssueSelection (https://jira.intelie.com/s/beeb1903970417fbb56db7a437074874-CDN/-n4qo83/73011/61ff054b82e8d98ad612d82b470d3391/2.2.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:41:17362)
at i.adaptToExternalIssueSelection (https://jira.intelie.com/s/beeb1903970417fbb56db7a437074874-CDN/-n4qo83/73011/61ff054b82e8d98ad612d82b470d3391/2.2.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:41:20431)
at h.issue:selected (https://jira.intelie.com/s/beeb1903970417fbb56db7a437074874-CDN/-n4qo83/73011/61ff054b82e8d98ad612d82b470d3391/2.2.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:41:23700)
at y (https://jira.intelie.com/s/beeb1903970417fbb56db7a437074874-CDN/-n4qo83/73011/61ff054b82e8d98ad612d82b470d3391/2.2.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-common-shared-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-common-shared-scripts.js?locale=en-US:244:8753)
at v (https://jira.intelie.com/s/beeb1903970417fbb56db7a437074874-CDN/-n4qo83/73011/61ff054b82e8d98ad612d82b470d3391/2.2.0/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-common-shared-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-common-shared-scripts.js?locale=en-US:244:8487)
{code}

h2. Work-around
Open the schedule config (cog wheel in the top-right area of the screen) and disable the _Sprints_ option

h3. We are working on this issue with high priority.
fields.summary: Selecting issues in the scope table causes bummer for sprint lanes showing no entries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1808].
  {panel}

As a Team Manager, I'd like to know the capacity of my teams, group by skills, in order to be able to easily determine bottlenecks (or overcapacity) so that :
 * I can accept or not any new project.
 * Decide to hire or not.

For that, a graph with the team's occupation group by skills would be perfect.
fields.summary: Report team's capacity by skills

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1807].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

There is no way to see history of plan changes. (I meant *committed* changes.)
In some use case, users want to look back the previous plans.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nicer if there is history function (or something like that) to look back the previous plans even after committing plan changes.
fields.summary: History of plan changes
Report on how scheduling logic was applied

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1805].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The JQL using the Portfolio Team field does not return subtasks in results


h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Stories and subtasks in the Portfolio
# Add a Shared Team to all issues
# Search for issues using a JQL: 
#* Team = "shared team name"

h3. Expected Results
All issues that have this Team should be found

h3. Actual Results
Subtasks are not in the JQL results


h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: The JQL using Portfolio Team field to find issue doesn't return subtasks in the results
When clicking an Epic in the timeline, display related Initiative and Stories
